adx_keywords: Ullah, Akayed;Times Square and 42nd Street (Manhattan, NY);Subways;Evacuations and Evacuees;Port Authority Bus Terminal (Manhattan, NY);Terrorism;Bombs and Explosives
byline: By SARAH MASLIN NIR and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
title: Bomber Strikes Near Times Square, Disrupting City but Killing None
abstract: The would-be suicide attacker told officials he set off the bomb in retaliation for U.S. strikes on ISIS, targeting a subway tunnel because of its Christmas-themed posters.

media.caption: After an explosion on Monday, police officers blocked a passageway connecting the Times Square and Port Authority subway stations in New York.
media.copyright: Jeenah Moon for The New York Times

byline: By MAGGIE HABERMAN, GLENN THRUSH and PETER BAKER
title: Inside Trump’s Hour-by-Hour Battle for Self-Preservation
abstract: With Twitter as his Excalibur, the president takes on his doubters, powered by long spells of cable news and a dozen Diet Cokes. But if Mr. Trump has yet to bend the presidency to his will, he is at least wrestling it to a draw.

media.caption: President Trump during a news conference in the Rose Garden last month.

title: Why Experts Don’t Believe This Is a Rare First Map of America

media.caption: This newly discovered print of Martin Waldseemüller’s 1507 map was to be sold at auction this month until experts raised concerns about its authenticity.

title: Nikki Haley Says Women Who Accuse Trump of Misconduct ‘Should Be Heard’
